answer:
Hey, thanks for asking! ~ now you get to see me ramble ahaha

  • 4. What is your favourite historical era?

WOAH I love SO MANY historical eras so i canât pick a favourite but here are some things that i like~

  • ANCIENT GREECE AND ROME AYYYY i CAN TALK ABOUT THEM FOR DAYSÂ 
  • Visigoths & Ostrogoths - so post-Roman EuropeÂ 
  • Hellenistic Greece too wow (iâm doing my dissertation on Alexander the Great next year i am EXCITED)
  • to that end the Perisan Empire, the whole Babylonian Empire, Assyrian Empire, the Seleucid Empire too & the Ottoman EmpireÂ 
  • the Crusades (ilu Saladin)Â 
  • feudal Japan. all of Japan. all of it.Â 
  • the Byzantine Empire! (hella long thing tbh)Â 
  • the whole Tang Dynasty - i went to an exhibition in Singapore about the Famen Temple and it was really, really incredible PLUS they considered chubby women with odd eyebrows the biggest babes of the time, a+ work Tang dynastyÂ 
  • all of Dowager Empress Cixiâs reignÂ !! all of China really tbh
  • been v interested in Cambodian history too ~ and the Nguyen lords of VietnamÂ 
  • watched like 12 Ghengis Khan movies one night so currently FUCK YEAH MONGOLSÂ 
  • British Empire (vvv interesting & important, also Stamford Raffles is in my top 5 historical babes of all time, Francis Light too. most of the other dudes were fuckwads though.)Â 
  • thereâs a lot of cool African history going on too, i studied the Atlantic slave trade & the Balanta people especially interested me. also the entire concept of Sierra Leoneâs witch cities, i mean WOW how cool
  • Elizabeth I - Charles II is a very interesting period for British monarchyÂ 
  • literally all of Egypt ever, with special mention to my girls Hatshepsut & Queen TiyÂ 
  • Austro-Hungarian EmpireÂ ! god this is so vague iâm sorryÂ

  • also Renaissance Italy ~ i just had an exam on it. let me talk to you about classical ideology influencing patrician conspiracies in the 1470s.Â 
  • (also i love Gladstone and Disraeli whoops) but blame the Bartimaeus trilogy for my Gladstone fanning. i also have a Gladstone Log.Â 
  • Living in Singapore got me interested in Peranakan culture & the whole history of South East Asia generally ~ GOD THIS IS SO GENERAL BUT I LOVE ALL OF HISTORY ITâS A PROBLEM
  • i think everyone loves 1920s America? or at least finds it super interestingÂ 
  • the Russian Revolution holds a special place in my heart too ~

I could go on forever as i think of things, iâm so sorry ~Â

currently the POLISH WINGED HUSSARS

GODDAM GODDAM GODDAM GODDAMÂ 

for real though i could ramble for days on this one too so iâm just picking todayâs favourite.Â 

  • 10. What piece(s) of art (painting, sculpture, lithograph, etc.) related to history you most like most?

i struggled with this one bc i really, really love art and i have a lot of faves, but the thing that always tops the list is Goyaâs Disasters of War

i mean HOLY FUCK those pictures are incredible.Â go wiki them if you donât know them! i think seeing them on a screen doesnât really do them justice -bc they are super impactful in real life and really emotive and arresting. also they cover a very interesting period in history ~

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Disasters_of_War

honourable mentions to everything made during the Renaissance, everything ever made in the ancient world esp all the statues with their immaculate marble booties, everything in the National Gallery, Hieronymous Boschâs stuff, Â and also the royal crown of Hungary.Â 

OH ALSO

THIS PIC OF HERNY WRIOTHESELY who had exactly my hair at the time

25. Who do you consider to be the most overrated historical figure?

Napoleon is overrated tbh, i donât find him very compelling -JFK too. my grandfather wrote a book on Nelson and hated him by the end.Â also Henry Kissinger, and pretty much everyone glorified by their involvement in the British Empire.Â 

i also think Marie Antionette is a bit over-exposed? yes tragic, but there are a lot of really interesting queens out thereÂ !Â 

gosh SORRY FOR RAMBLING, and thank you for asking xxÂ
